The district has selected a “variable student instructional year” calendar due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The first day of school for students will be Wednesday, August 26. The calendar, see attached, includes a traditional fall break and spring break.
This calendar includes 164 instructional days with ten minutes added to the end of the school day in order to meet the state requirement of 1,062 instructional hours. The first professional day for staff will be August 12 and run through August 17. Staff planning days will be August 18 through August 24. Opening day for staff will be August 25.
As the summer progresses, the district will provide updated information on how the school year will begin. Decisions will be based on guidance from state and local health officials and approved by the Board of Education.

post_text: Good evening! Muhlenberg County Schools received good news for families with students who were enrolled from Head Start to 12th grade this past school year. Because Muhlenberg County Schools are a part of the Community Eligibility Program, families may apply and receive funds to spend on food at home for students. Students who are currently receiving SNAP benefits or who receive Medicaid or KTAP benefits or who are in foster care will automatically receive benefits and no further action is required. All other students may apply by completing a simple online application at https://benefind.ky.gov/. Those applying will need the student’s name, address, date of birth and Statewide Student Identification found on Parent Portal, student’s grade card, or by contacting the student’s school. Applications are open from June 1 to June 30.

Read Across America Day, also known as Dr. Seuss Day, is held on the birthday of Dr. Seuss, the author of over 60 children’s books. Each year, the Muhlenberg County Courthouse opens their doors and hallways to SOAR and partners to celebrate Dr. Seuss and the importance of reading. This year Ace2 , First Steps, HANDS, Muhlenberg County Public Libraries, Owensboro Health Muhlenberg Community Hospital, Pathway of Hope, Pennyroyal Regional Prevention Center, Sanctuary INC and UK Extension joined SOAR to give children treats and parents information about their organizations.
The Muhlenberg County Job Corps students help out each year, wearing Dr. Seuss character costumes and greeting children as they come to the courthouse.
Elected officials give away a free book at each office and talk to parents as they make their way through the building.
This year’s event attracted 305 children and 168 adults. SOAR distributed over 2,000 books.

February 6 at 8:31 PM ·

I am so proud of our school system and community partners! We are working hard to develop a long-term, sustainable mental health network for our students and families. So far, we have partnered with Mountain Comprehensive, GRREC, and Pennyroyal Center to provide school-based counseling services during the school day. In addition, each school has at least one guidance counselor who provides daily support to our kiddos. Also part of this great team are our school psychologists who offer crisis response and counseling services. A special “thank you” goes out to our administrators and principals who support our staff and students by allowing us to do this important work.

We will be kicking off our “STOP THE STIGMA” campaign soon! Check out our models below. ⬇️⬇️
